lexUnit.name: smart.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: feel a sharp, poignant pain.

sentence.text: He pushed past them frantically , his eyes smarting from the dust .
Jack stayed where he was , his face still smarting from the punch .
The Christian soldiers spent a thirsty and sleepless night , their eyes smarting from the smoke which blew into their camp as the enemy systematically set fire to the dry scrub around them .
She blinked artificial eyelashes over wide , brown eyes that were smarting from the vanity of contact lenses .
To be honest I 'm still smarting from the various wounds she inflicted .
The inside of his hands smarted under the heat of it .
Then everything came back in a wave of anguish and she ducked her head under the water and made herself hold her eyes open until they smarted with pain .
She whipped these out to try and smother the blaze , her eyes smarting with the smoke .
` Suicide seems unlikely , " reflected Auguste dully , eyes smarting with tiredness .
After a moment 's hesitation she lay back , plunging her head deep in the water before shampooing her hair with the gel , gasping as her wound smarted horribly .

Her head smarted painfully where several strands of hair had been wrenched out by her violent struggles , the fragile material of her shift had torn further , and she was shaking uncontrollably and unable to stand upright .
Jackson was still smarting when he returned to the station in the city centre .
Willie turned quickly away and walked out of the door , his ears smarting .
Benny 's hands were smarting and he rubbed them gently on his shirt .
His own eye smarted , exposed to the draft coming through the key-hole .
There was silence , and his eyes smarted .
